abstract: The two-hour season premiere of “Grey’s Anatomy” vaulted ABC to No. 1 in the ratings on Thursday, averaging 18.3 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although down from the show’s fourth season debut a year ago, which drew 20.9 million, Thursday’s episode easily led the night with the largest audience overall. ABC’s “Ugly Betty” premiere came up shorter at 8 p.m. (9.8 million), down more than a million from last year’s debut.

lead_paragraph: The two-hour season premiere of “Grey’s Anatomy” vaulted ABC to No. 1 in the ratings on Thursday, averaging 18.3 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although down from the show’s fourth season debut a year ago, which drew 20.9 million, Thursday’s episode easily led the night with the largest audience over all. ABC’s “Ugly Betty” premiere came up shorter at 8 p.m. (9.8 million), down more than a million from last year’s debut.
